docs.title: 🖥️ Windows Lab Knowledge Base
docs.text: Welcome to the Windows Lab Knowledge Base — a live documentation site for building, securing, and managing a Windows environment.

docs.title: 🌐 Purpose
docs.text: This site exists to: - Document a repeatable Windows lab setup with a focus on security and best practices. - Provide step-by-step learning notes for Windows administration and PowerShell. - Serve as a living reference — regularly updated through changelogs. - Bridge the gap between hands-on labs and structured documentation.

docs.title: 📖 What You’ll Find
docs.text:
• Guides & Notes – Practical references for Windows tools, features, and admin tasks.
  • PowerShell Learning Path – From basics to real-world administration.
  • Security Principles – Account management, auditing, policies, and secure configuration.
  • Changelog – A running log of progress and updates to the lab environment.

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Explore the sections using the navigation menu.
  2. Follow the PowerShell Learning Path to build foundational skills.
  3. Review the Security Principles for secure configurations.
  4. Check the Changelog for the latest lab setup progress.

docs.title: 📜 License
docs.text: Open and shareable under the MIT License. Reuse, adapt, and learn — attribution appreciated.

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text: A record of lab setup progress and configuration changes.
Windows 11 Lab Environment Setup - Installed Windows 11 - Guest Additions installed - Secure Boot + TPM confirmed - Shared folder working
Baseline Tools Installed - PowerShell 7 - Notepad++ - Git - 7-Zip - SysInternals Suite All verified and configured
User & Security Configuration - Created Admin and Standard User accounts - Applied basic security principles: - Password rules - User Account Control (UAC) - Firewall enabled - Auditing configured
